SEARCH
Module paths
Package ntnu.idatt2001.ejhaslerjorgfi.model

Class Story

java.lang.Object
ntnu.idatt2001.ejhaslerjorgfi.model.Story
public class Story extends Object

Story

Definition

Represents an interactive and non-linear narrative which a Player can explore. A Story consists of several Passages acting as events being connected to each other by Links acting as paths.

Functionality

Story objects can be considered as collections of events and options represented by Passage- and Link-instances. A Story object will have a opening Passage which acts as the introductory event or the starting paragraph of the Story. A Player can from this point interact through choosing acting options which affects how the plot will develop throughout the Story.

Attributes

An instance of Story will have a name associated to it in the title field. The title describes what the main theme of the Story is, as well as acting as an identifier.

The Story will have a collection of passages stored as an implementation of the Map interface. This collection contains Link objects, acting as paths, which are referencing to Passage objects acting as events. All scenarios and the actions that leads to them in the Story is stored in the collection.

Each Story has a Passage object representing the starting event of the Story, which is being stored in the openingPassage field. This Passage is the first Passage which the Player will encounter when experiencing a specific Story.

Since:
12.02.2023
Version:
12.03.2023
Author:
Group 24

  • Constructor Details

    • Story

      public Story(String title, Passage openingPassage)
      Creates a new instance of the Story class with a descriptive title and a Passage acting as the starting point.
      Parameters:
      title - the title of the Story.
      openingPassage - the Passage object which the Story starts from.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - If the title parameter has the value 'null'
      BlankStringException - If the title argument is either an empty string or consist of only white spaces. Utilizes the .blank() method of the String-class.

  • Method Details

    • getTitle

      public String getTitle()
      Returns the value of the title field of a Story object.
      Returns:
      the title of the Story.

    • getOpeningPassage

      public Passage getOpeningPassage()
      Returns the value of the openingPassage of a Story object.
      Returns:
      the opening Passage of the Story.

    • getPassages

      public Collection<Passage> getPassages()
      Returns a Collection of Passage instances which is held by the Story object.
      Returns:
      a Collection of Passage objects held by the Story.

    • getPassage

      public Passage getPassage(Link link)
      Returns the Passage object associated to a given Link.
      Parameters:
      passage - the Link object leading to a certain Passage.
      Returns:
      the Passage being mapped to the given Link, or null if the Link provided does not exist in the map.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if the Link objec is null.

    • addPassage

      public void addPassage(Passage passage)
      Adds an instance of Passage to a Story object's map of Passage objects.
      Parameters:
      passage - the Passage which are to be added to the Story.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the Passage is null.

    • removePassage

      public void removePassage(Link link)
      Removes a given Passage from passages. It is not possible to remove the Passage if other Passages link to it.
      Parameters:
      link - the Link of the Passage to remove.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if other passages link to the Passage to be removed.

    • getBrokenLinks

      public List<Link> getBrokenLinks()
      Finds and returns a list of broken Links. A Link is broken if it refers to a Passage that does not exist in passages.
      Returns:
      a List of broken Link objects.
